New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history with a 118.1-mph laser into the right-center-field seats for his career-high 47th homer
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sparked a five-run, six-hit first inning in which Edman, Will Smith, and Muncy hit back-to-back-to-back homers
Bobby Miller gave up six runs and five hits, including two homers, while walking four and striking out two in 4-1/3 innings
The Dodgers took an 8-7 lead in the seventh when Smith hit a one-out double to right-center and took third on Muncy's groundout
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts said, 'I saw a lot of fight. It's been a while since I've felt the energy, the buzz in the dugout that we had in that first inning.'
Dave Roberts also said, 'With all we've gone through, Shohei hitting leadoff and doing what he's done has allowed us to stay above water.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep, pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona and 5Â½ over San Diego, and reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play
Shohei Ohtani is close to becoming the first major leaguer to hit 50 homers and steal 50 bases in a season
Shohei Ohtani is also in a spirited battle with New York Mets shortstop Francisco Lindor for the NL most valuable player award
Others: The game was played at Dodger Stadium, and the Dodgers gave away free catcher's gear to fans in the right-field pavilion as part of 'Chest Protector Night'
